content.description:
Climb up the face to a huge undercling at the first bolt. Move right up the weakness and up past a thin section by the second bolt. At the ledge, climb up the middle of the face (between the two cracks) on slab with not much for hands but tons of bumps for feet.

Crux is the face finish on top.
content.protection:
5 bolts, Mussy hooks anchors

Shares anchors with Apollo and Husker
content.location: starts by the huecos to the right of the painted over graffiti.

content.description:
This route is a series of two boulder problems with a giant ledge in between. The start is a slightly overhanging high reach/mantle move to gain the first ledge.

Once on the ledge, the second boulder problem starts with a protective bolt midway up the problem. finishing on the ledge to the left with a far right reach to the anchors.
content.location: About 100 feet left of Apollo on the West face of Caprica.

content.description:
Start below the finger crack and move slightly right onto the ledge above. Take the hand+ crack up over the top section. For New Jack, the rock is solid and takes gear well.

You can top rope by scrambling from the back or east side or by leading either sport route first.
content.protection:
Pro to 4", Mussy hook anchors

Shares anchors with Apollo and Starbuck

content.description: Just to the lest of Number Six, Gaius follows the upward path of small huecos that are more like jugs and good slopers. One sketchy move that is midway up. A fun easy lead with a little spice in the middle.
content.location: South side of Caprica. Just left (10 feat) of Number Six

content.description: Climb the face immediately right of Starbuck up to a small bush located in a crack. Then continue left up the upper 2 bolts of Starbuck.
content.location: 10' right of the start of Starbuck

content.description:
Start just right of the black water streak and move up a small fingertip flake past the first bolt. Slab moves up to the ledge at the base of the hand crack and big horn. This one strangely gets easier the shorter you are.

You can scramble up the back or the side to set a top rope. Watch out for rattlers.
content.protection:
5 bolts, Mussy hooks

Shares anchor with Husker and Starbuck
